verses.verse: And it came to pass<WH7586>, when Saul was returned<WH7725> from following<WH310> the Philistines<WH6430>, that it was told<WH5046> him<WH559>, saying, Behold<WH1732>, David is in the wilderness<WH4057> of En-gedi<WH5872>.

And it came to pass afterward<WH310>, that David<WH1732>'s heart<WH3820> smote<WH5221> him<WH3772>, because he had cut off Saul<WH7586>'s skirt<WH3671>.

And he said<WH559> unto his men<WH582>, Jehovah<WH3068> forbid<WH2486> that I should do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697> unto my lord<WH113>, Jehovah<WH3068>'s anointed<WH4899>, to put forth<WH7971> my hand<WH3027> against him<WH3068>, seeing he is Jehovah's anointed<WH4899>.

So David<WH1732> checked<WH8156> his men<WH582> with these words<WH1697>, and suffered<WH5414> them not to rise<WH6965> against Saul<WH7586>. And Saul<WH7586> rose up<WH6965> out of the cave<WH4631>, and went<WH3212> on his way<WH1870>.

David <WH1732> also arose<WH6965> afterward<WH3318>, and went out of the cave<WH4631>, and cried<WH7121> after<WH310> Saul<WH7586>, saying<WH559>, My lord<WH113> the king<WH4428>. And when Saul<WH7586> looked<WH5027> behind<WH310> him<WH1732>, David bowed<WH6915> with his face<WH639> to the earth<WH776>, and did obeisance<WH7812>.
And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Saul<WH7586>, Wherefore hearkenest<WH8085> thou to men<WH120>'s words<WH1697>, saying<WH559>, Behold<WH1732>, David seeketh<WH1245> thy hurt<WH7451>?

Behold <WH3117>, this day thine eyes<WH5869> have seen<WH7200> how that Jehovah<WH3068> had delivered<WH5414> thee to-day<WH3117> into my hand<WH3027> in the cave<WH4631>: and some bade<WH559> me kill<WH2026> thee<WH2347>; but mine eye spared thee<WH559>; and I said, I will not put forth<WH7971> my hand<WH3027> against my lord<WH113>; for he is Jehovah<WH113>'s anointed<WH4899>.

Moreover <WH1>, my father, see<WH7200>, yea<WH7200>, see the skirt<WH3671> of thy robe<WH4598> in my hand<WH3027>; for in that I cut off<WH3772> the skirt<WH3671> of thy robe<WH4598>, and killed<WH2026> thee not<WH3045>, know thou and see<WH7200> that there is neither evil<WH7451> nor transgression<WH6588> in my hand<WH3027>, and I have not sinned<WH2398> against thee<WH6658>, though thou huntest after my life<WH5315> to take it<WH3947>.
Jehovah <WH3068> judge<WH8199> between me and thee<WH3068>, and Jehovah avenge<WH5358> me of thee<WH3027>; but my hand shall not be upon thee.
As saith<WH559> the proverb<WH4912> of the ancients<WH6931>, Out of the wicked<WH7563> cometh<WH3318> forth wickedness<WH7562>; but my hand shall not be upon thee<WH3027>.
After <WH310> whom is the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> come out<WH3318>? after<WH310> whom dost thou pursue<WH7291>? after<WH310> a dead<WH4191> dog<WH3611>, after<WH310> a<WH259> flea<WH6550>.
Jehovah <WH3068> therefore be judge<WH1781>, and give sentence<WH8199> between me and thee<WH7200>, and see, and plead<WH7378> my cause<WH7379>, and deliver<WH8199> me out of thy hand<WH3027>.

And it came to pass<WH1732>, when David had made an end<WH3615> of speaking<WH1696> these words<WH1697> unto Saul<WH7586>, that Saul<WH7586> said<WH559>, Is this thy voice<WH6963>, my son<WH1121> David<WH1732>? And Saul<WH7586> lifted up<WH5375> his voice<WH6963>, and wept<WH1058>.
And he said<WH559> to David<WH1732>, Thou art more righteous<WH6662> than I<WH1580>; for thou hast rendered unto me good<WH2896>, whereas I have rendered<WH1580> unto thee evil<WH7451>.

And thou hast declared<WH5046> this day<WH3117> how that thou hast dealt<WH6213> well<WH2896> with me<WH3068>, forasmuch as when Jehovah had delivered<WH5462> me up into thy hand<WH3027>, thou killedst me not<WH2026>.

For if a man<WH376> find<WH4672> his enemy<WH341>, will he let him go<WH7971> well<WH2896> away<WH1870>? wherefore Jehovah<WH3068> reward<WH7999> thee good<WH2896> for that which thou hast done<WH6213> unto me this day<WH3117>.
And now<WH3045>, behold, I know that thou shalt surely<WH4427> be king<WH4427>, and that the kingdom<WH4467> of Israel<WH3478> shall be established<WH6965> in thy hand<WH3027>.

Swear <WH7650> now therefore unto me by Jehovah<WH3068>, that thou wilt not<WH518> cut off<WH3772> my seed<WH2233> after<WH310> me<WH8045>, and that thou wilt not destroy my name<WH8034> out of my father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>.
And David<WH1732> sware<WH7650> unto Saul<WH7586>. And Saul<WH7586> went<WH3212> home<WH1004>; but David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> gat them up<WH5927> unto the stronghold<WH4686>.
